required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of Novel BTE and SP Hearing Aid Models
clinical_study.official_title: Validation of 2 Novel BTE Hearing Aid Models Varying With Respect to Regular-power or Super-power Gain Specifications

brief_summary.textblock: Participants will wear one set of 2 different BTE hearing aid models based on the gain required by their hearing loss. The hearing aids will be programmed based on a prescriptive approach and participants will be sent out for either one home trial with the less powerful BTEs or for two home trials with the SP (super power) BTEs.

detailed_description.textblock: During this study each participant will be asked to wear a set of BTE hearing aids home and wear them daily. We will be assessing their evaluation of the BTEs during and after their home field trial. They will be asked to report on their use with different apps/accessories. Subjective performance ratings will be collected.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 2 groups based on hearing aid gain needs; one similar intervention

primary_outcome.description: Subjective evaluation of sound quality using Sound Quality Ratings from Gabrielsson et al 1988 (The effects of different frequency responses on sound quality judgments and speech intelligibility. JSHR. Vol.31)

secondary_outcome.description: Reports of system stability with accessories and Subjective evaluation of sound quality using Sound Quality Ratings from Gabrielsson et al 1988 (The effects of different frequency responses on sound quality judgments and speech intelligibility. JSHR. Vol.31)

Reports of app usability/sound quality using Sound Quality Ratings from Gabrielsson et al 1988 (The effects of different frequency responses on sound quality judgments and speech intelligibility. JSHR. Vol.31)

arm_group.description: BTE or SP-BTE (super power) hearing aid fitting

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- hearing aid candidacy (N2-N7 hearing loss)
- healthy outer and middle ears
- ability to complete questionnaires
- willingness to use smartphone
- informed consent documented by a signature
- willingness to wear a binaural BTE fitting
- willingness to use app and accessories
- willingness to adhere to COVID protocols
Exclusion Criteria:
- contraindications to the MD in this study: known hypersensitivity or allergy to investigational product/earmold
- limited mobility/not able to attend appointments
- limited ability to describe listening impressions/experiences
- inability to produce a reliable hearing test result
- limited dexterity - to point that participant cannot manage hearing aid insertion/removal
- known psychological disorders
